I'm getting some pretty bizarre errors with JUnit that I think are=

wo=
rks fine. But when I run tests with the JUnit textUI -- using the  
exact s=
ame classpath (which includes junit.jar) -- it fails with an  
exception: j=
ava.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:  
com/sun/activation/registries/LogSupport. =
  
  
It's true that the class is not in the classpath, but why does it  
s=
uddenly need it under JUnit when the exact same scenario works fine  
outsi=
de of JUnit? The 2 tests in my TestCase do, in fact, run but it  
appears t=
o gets an exception when reporting the results. The last  
step in the test=
 scenario is to send an email. This does not occur  
because of the excepti=
on.  
  
Furthermore, when I run it using the JUnit GUI using the exact sam=
e  
classpath I get a different set of errors! The tests do not appear 
to =
run under the GUI. 
  
Any insight will be greatly appreciated. I can provi=
de source,   
scripts, jars etc.
